attributes.action: Give UK women in full-time education/on benefits to receive free sanitary wear.
attributes.additional_details: We want feminine product manufacturers to donate products to domestic violence refuges, charities supporting homeless women and girls and the donations to be made in the UK. The campaign is dedicated to focusing on the aid of women on means tested benefits as well as girls within full time education residing in the United Kingdom. Once this has been achieved, we wish to broaden our assistance towards all kinds of women in need and suffering from period poverty within the UK.
attributes.background: In Kelmscott Secondary School, our group of Youth Health Champions and Team London Ambassadors have been campaigning since September to put a stop to period poverty by organising a campaign named Drip 16, involving producing a government funded P-Card (Period Card) that gives out free sanitary wear.

rejection.details:
We think this petition is similar:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/258046

The UK Government uses VAT collected on sanitary projects to support charites and projects in aid of women's health. You can find out how to apply here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/tampon-tax-fund-application-form-2019-2020-funding-round
